message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.HCI, cs.CL. 

The paper focuses on understanding reputation mechanisms in a social Q&A site, which involves analyzing user activity, judging authoritativeness, and identifying and promoting high-quality content. This aligns with several sub-categories in computer science, including social networks (cs.SI), social and information networks (cs.SOC), information retrieval (cs.IR), human-computer interaction (cs.HCI), and computational linguistics (cs.CL). However, since the paper primarily deals with social Q&A sites and user reputation, we believe cs.SI and cs.SOC are the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.IR, cs.HCI, and cs.CL.
